definition: any of various usually cold dishes: such as
raw greens (such as lettuce) often combined with other vegetables and toppings and served especially with dressing
small pieces of food (such as pasta, meat, fruit, or vegetables) usually mixed with a dressing (such as mayonnaise) or set in gelatin
a green vegetable or herb grown for salad
a usually incongruous mixture : hodgepodge
a mixture of raw green vegetables (such as different types of lettuce) usually combined with other raw vegetables
a mixture of small pieces of raw or cooked food (such as pasta, meat, fruit, eggs, or vegetables) combined usually with a dressing and served cold
a mixture of raw usually green leafy vegetables (as lettuce) combined with other vegetables (as tomato and cucumber) and served with a dressing
a mixture of small pieces of food (as meat, fish, pasta, fruit, or vegetables) usually combined with a dressing
in: For dinner we had roast chicken and a salad.
a salad of fresh greens
I tossed the salad with some oil and vinegar and set it on the table.
Would you like soup or salad with your sandwich?

definition: a food containing a mixture of raw vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers, usually served with a salad dressing
food that has been cut into small pieces and mixed together, usually with a sauce, and served cold
in: a pasta salad
toss a salad  (=mix it together with a salad dressing): Lightly toss the salad with the vinaigrette.
an egg salad sandwich
a fruit salad

definition: a mixture of uncooked vegetables, usually including lettuce, eaten either as a separate dish or with other food:
cooked or uncooked vegetables cut into very small pieces and often mixed with mayonnaise:
a salad made with tuna, cheese, egg, etc. and lettuce or other cold ingredients:
tuna, cheese, egg, etc. mixed with mayonnaise, used to make a sandwich:
a mixture of raw vegetables, usually covered with a salad dressing:
A salad is also a dish of small pieces of cold food, usually mixed with a sauce such as mayonnaise (= a thick sauce of oil, vinegar, and eggs):
in: Toss (= mix) the salad with a vinaigrette dressing.
Serve the risotto with a mixed/green salad.
a salad bowl
potato salad
rice/pasta salad
She had a tuna salad for lunch.
I'll have egg salad on brown (bread), please.
a green salad
Lunches include soup or salad.
tuna/egg/potato/macaroni salad
We buy pre-packed salads—we do not wash lettuce any more.
We are in the fifth year of war and the fourth season of fresh fruits and salads.
He spoke about salads, lettuces, tomatoes and so on and deplored the fact that at the beginning of the season prices are high.
Restaurants that previously sold salads and other low-calorie foods are now offering indulgent, high-calorie items, including foie gras in the more expensive ones.
The likely cause was cross-contamination from chicken which was defrosted in metal trays normally used for salads.
There are regulations, for instance, preventing a farmer from harvesting any tomatoes, salads and fruit immediately after having sprayed them with insecticide.
In the summer, old people like to have salads, but we know that the price of tomatoes is high.
Obviously, the long summer that we have just experienced and the desire for salads and the like causes an alteration of emphasis on horticultural products.
Salads have been at a prohibitive price, as has been almost every form of fruit, and tinned stuff is quite impossible for the old-age pensioner.
I love cold meats, salads and eggs, but the cost is high.
I should like action to be taken to protect green salads in the food shops themselves.
We need to secure a better distribution of salads, vegetables and fruits which are in relatively short supply.
The people of my division have to take the cast-offs of the shops and present them in the form of salads.
In certain circumstances the prices of many green vegetables and salads will be beyond the reach of that type of family.
Today, it is possible to produce many foodstuffs - such as gourmet salads - with and without preservatives.

definition: Yob, in the south we call people salads who are young and partake in criminal activity

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
A salad is a term to define an attractive looking female that looks as if she is worth having sexual intercourse with.
a polite way of saying sex
Another word for hair- the stuff on your head.
mixing your weed with someone elses in the same bowl
Endearing term for one's wife/partner/girlfriend mainly used in relation to a BBQ invite
